3FFC58E309FF448F8F4DF2C32F5127AB.description:
Takes a leadership role in collaborative groups and completion of group projects by fulfilling own responsibilities effectively while
enabling others to contribute their best work as well

ED3B298135EC4F4F83EEEDF7F7E962DB.description:
Identifies an authentic problem or issue, researches and shares research information to raise awareness of the issue or the changes
needed, identifies effective ways to address the issue, and collaborates to advocate or take action to implement those ideas

43B0D6DC6B08434BA05A4D28522EFF07.description:
Displays self-confidence in own ability to take risks in learning, fail, learn from failure, and change approach, conclusions, or opinions
based on new or more accurate information

052D635F3D5348D3B93D6AD93D1297A7.description: Displays self-confidence in forming and sharing own opinion and ideas and questioning ideas that are different from or conflict with own

9F3A497A3B944F9F94FE70D609103150.description: Information-fluent learners develop agency (personal identity and confidence) to express their ideas, raise awareness, advocate for change, and/or take social action.

2CD7EB632E8E4B8EA246322AAE02CC6E.description:
Demonstrates leadership and self-confidence by facilitating collaborative decision making and problem solving based on assessment of
the current situation, feedback from others, and consideration of own ethical and social responsibilities [responsible decision-making]

7014287164954128800988EBA7F2DCAD.description: Demonstrates respect and empathy for diverse people and perspectives [social awareness]

B6B7C33F634748339F6A60AC82A546A6.description:
Develops interpersonal skills to build trusting relationships with diverse peers and adults through collaboration and communication
[relationship skills]

23DB0910F68249FAA0234E6FABB1DCDE.description:
Uses information and technology to address personal issues and investigate opportunities for the future, including higher education,
career training, vocational training

3D6B97BC41BF4BC99BFE5C69F28C4F15.description:
Selects print and nonprint materials based on personal interests, knowledge of authors, reading level and aspirations for future growth
and career

1D0A325F7ED64DA1B6B9C56003AB86C1.description:
Identifies social media contexts that are of personal interest, determines the content and ârules of engagementâ for each, joins or
accesses each appropriately (e.g., finding people to follow on Twitter), and uses communication strategies appropriate for each contextÂ

16C68A557DAB487C91FB592845CAC087.description: Personal Exploration and Independent Reading and Learning

60850D5A1867422DB34FDDEFF5A96BDB.description: Information-fluent learners use information and ideas presented in any format to reflect on and pursue personal interests, develop strengths, and engage in personalized and independent learning.

518F46F6AEBF4FBA996A999F00700F4D.description: Personal Growth and Agency: Engage in Personal Exploration, Social and Emotional Growth, Independent Reading and Learning, and Personal Agency

8C2F3061AC8143F9B8FDB9FDD3F512F5.description:
Analyzes the consequences and costs of hacking, spamming, consumer fraud, virus setting, intrusion and other unethical uses of
information and communication technology and identifies ways for addressing these risks

D1B76C3DC0A1426F9ECA364E6161B5AA.description:
Demonstrates netiquette behavior by respecting others; using appropriate language, images and emoticons; thinking before sending or
forwarding messages; creating safe screen names; and challenging cyberbullyingÂ

ABE98C9DEC354443B2EABBBCCB658D53.description: Abides by the Acceptable Use Policy in all respects

7300AE6B698447248615D1044671F7CA.description: Safe and Ethical Use of Technology

460E2E0CA55E43AFB548E1FD4EBE421A.description:
Demonstrates respect for copyright, fair use, creative commons, and attribution of information and images and acquires permission from
creator when necessary

E976DF892AF4454C87AE346B91230ABF.description: Information-fluent learners demonstrate digital citizenship by maintaining ethical decision making and behavior and avoiding the spread of misinformation in the exchange and use of information.

E8F0AAD4087A4FF188FEFE2FF7DBFF12.description:
Works collaboratively to design, develop, publish, and present multimedia projects that effectively communicate information and ideas
about the curriculum to authentic audiences

A9B5962B8C4B42E19F27EBFEF653246D.description: Curates and shares valuable resources with peers

A8906E3700584CF58EAF802714ADC46A.description: Information-fluent learners demonstrate effective collaboration in the exchange of information, in both the face-to-face and digital environment.

60C2CFD0A6E94B91833C01C7A8C7F11F.description:
Demonstrates critical evaluation strategies that are appropriate for various types of sources (e.g., authoritative websites, fringe or fake
websites, opinion essays, blogs, tweets, viral videos)

0D9068DAD3B64C92A1BE6E8536CAE298.description:
Engages in civic online reasoning by verifying information that is presented as the truth, recognizing the impact of social-media format on
information, and actively seeking multiple perspectives

748EE712A6D9445EA296EF58548AA566.description: Learning from Diverse and Credible Points of View

3C546EC759BE4F4A89C66D3D1DAE951D.description: Information-fluent learners recognize the importance of accurate information to a democratic society and actively seek, evaluate, learn from, and use credible information from diverse community and global perspectives.

C7AF4AB49CC94A61A0336AA2263A2C7B.description: Social and Civic Responsibility: Demonstrate Civic Responsibility, Respect for Diverse Perspectives, Collaboration, and Digital Citizenship

A9620007ED5D4CEBA797F99BFE9F32ED.description:
Delivers presentations to authentic audiences and peers with self-confidence, clarity, attention to the intended impact on the audience,
and an âexpertâ or âprofessionalâ stance

F4F38E34CF6D497BBB8CE8733CC504A2.description: Assesses and revises own products by using the criteria of clarity, accuracy, relevance, sufficiency, logic, depth, and breadth

4510A73252714D8DA82F5359D8A03FCA.description: Retrieves and uses images, sound, and visual media according to ethical and legal standards

F3785B0265C9406BAF2148C75FC01E7C.description: Information-fluent learners present their learning and ideas by constructing messages using multiple, authentic formats appropriate for the purpose and audience.

CCDE83D6C9B5419F87202EA44E8D16C2.description:
Uses social media (e.g., Wikipedia, Twitter, YouTube, online blogs) responsibly for the exchange of information and ideas by fact-checking
the information, avoiding the spread of misinformation, engaging in interactions around fact-based information, and respecting and
thoughtfully responding to the ideas of others

DF5BAD8C39A54AAE97C0F14548BE3DC4.description:
Identifies misinformation or biased information by analyzing and evaluating the motivations and creators of the false or misleading
information (e.g., profit, political motives, influence, point of view, social bots)

122C7BD5C4784EC682C5E2803FE57231.description: Interprets and evaluates visuals based on content analysis, visual analysis, contextual information, image source, and technical quality

B416601B6D394031B9B571F41921DBAE.description:
Analyzes maps, pictures, charts, graphs, and other information presented visually to determine main ideas, supporting details, point of
view, and both explicit and implicit meaning

4DD4BBE522994F79AB5367CD90331138.description:
Explores real-world genres as well as favorite genres and authors (movie reviews, editorials, consumer reports, game tips and strategies,
career information)

80490B03D7EE435AB2F42212160241CB.description:
Shares reading experiences and responses to literature in multiple ways (e.g., face-to-face conversations, technology presentations,
posters, creative products)

C355EBFA757E450E84DF717A80A46A2C.description: Information-fluent learners use multimedia literacy skills and knowledge to deconstruct and learn from texts in multiple formats through comprehension, analysis, interpretation, and evaluation.

C0BF81BA8E514408BCB7737BE3C19AA8.description: Multiple Literacies: Use Multiple Literacies to Explore, Learn, and Express Ideas

3E1F28A304F143AA97187DC020ECED92.description:
Publishes or presents the solution/model (to an authentic audience if possible) with evidence or line of reasoning about the expected
impact

8B6F8A88B9814928AA4681BFBDF7D868.description:
Engages actively in a design process to use tools, resources, and materials to test the hypothesis or desired result by creating a solution or
model, testing the results, modifying the solution/model when needed, and determining the validity of the hypothesis or the quality of
the model

89211FCF9D9444AA80FF30B75A1793E1.description:
Builds on real-world experiences to broaden perspective and open creative possibilities (e.g., field trips, makerspaces, hack-a-thons,
coding camps, video production centers)

B96149F01C9647C3B3C5579E7492F8F1.description:
Selects and uses resources and technology to investigate identified problems through active experimentation, experience, creation, and
engagementÂ

0BFAFC97D79E41CB835CD6C99CC60767.description: Information-fluent learners experience, experiment, and use a design process to discover creative solutions to authentic problems, form personal understandings, and propose original ideas.

7B91E0C00E1F46B88C678E1BE3B77204.description: Identifies own strengths (academic, social, and emotional) and sets goals about specific ways to improve in the futureÂ

D49767AF8A8D49C8B1A08F52DF82BC31.description:
Records and reflects on individual experience of the inquiry process â the hardest part, best part, important skills learned, insights
experienced, emotional highs and lows, etc.

55D5D08FB1CE49A29BFCF6E9BA3DF90C.description: Embeds citations to specific information, visuals, or sound when appropriate

9D406D5198EE45D6A93FAC36B9B84062.description: Cites all sources used according to standard style formats

DFD28C75C3794CA795B98121B1381BD4.description:
Evaluates own product and process throughout the work and uses self-assessment, teacher feedback, and peer feedback to make
revisions when necessary

D3D920441CD548ECB440D4300AC78312.description: Publishes final product for an authentic audience and real-world application

B8F33ED3A2C94FD1ADD776B9B92ECD3B.description:
Creates a product and presentation to present an argument, claim, point of view, interpretation, or new model most effectively for a
specific audience

A6F8A6ACFF5041069E31174C837DA20F.description:
Drafts the presentation/product to present the line of reasoning and evidence for an argument, claim, point of view, interpretation, or
new model most effectively with supporting evidence

E9F896A230A84D26A9BEF468CA737755.description: Develops own opinion, perspective, or claim and supports with evidence and a clear line of reasoning

537A40ABF5B64150BAC712299A8CB590.description: Builds a conceptual framework by synthesizing ideas gathered from multiple sourcesÂ

62EC74CEB8A8417B9DD55E28C0FE79D3.description: Draws clear and appropriate conclusions supported by evidence and examples

DFF43905855E4228BB3F2252EE2990EF.description:
Develops a line of argument or claim that incorporates and/or refutes competing interpretations or conflicting evidence with credible
evidence

3C9455C551804C68B83FB569CF4BD063.description: Organizes information independently, deciding the structure based on the relationships among ideas and general patterns discoveredÂ

073E2C23C8E444CCA0A56320A26C58FE.description:
Reflects on notes (perhaps in a reflection column) by asking questions, recording own opinions, challenging, and noting the importance of
the idea for the final product

1F421AD3A1F64E4F8B8B13A892338F6B.description: Takes notes using one or more of a variety of notetaking strategies including reflecting on the information (e.g., graphic organizers, twocolumn notes, concept maps)

8E7B4D5D0AD849F99889A400AEF482EB.description: Challenges ideas in text and makes notes of questions to pursue in additional sources

BEA56AC10D7149869DDB5E49893B7073.description:
Questions and challenges the text while reading or viewing to ensure comprehension and validation of accuracy and authority during the
process of gathering information

64FD78F76CE54F5BB8D99606BA57134D.description: Making Sense of Information and Notetaking

B9A72B97B3DB4B0CABC043F50F3DEAF8.description:
Draws meaning from digital text by employing print literacy and inquiry skills, interpreting meaning presented through multimedia,
interacting with the text, reading laterally (reading related information across multiple sites), and thinking non-linearly (using embedded
links and multiple sites)

3EF650594B244553B3FDDE22B6831430.description: Analyzes degrees of bias (from slightly slanted perspective to heavily slated propaganda) and the impact of that bias

1419045A33984C0185B5230C8DC5CE2E.description: Analyzes the impact of point of view, perspective, and purpose on the information provided by a source

DD85A2628FE94BF7814497B090014D2C.description: Evaluates digital information for authority, credibility, accuracy, comprehensiveness, point of view, and biasÂ

17202CBA77894E63AE3FE9326E2672F1.description: Compares information in diverse sources to corroborate accuracy, resolve conflicting evidence, and balance perspectives

32B8B54A2B6B480EB90A34E6933EE631.description:
Evaluates and selects evidence from multiple sources based on relevance and usefulness to answer research questions, currency,
authority, accuracy, comprehensiveness, and point of viewÂ

6A9CCA53676747CB82FFAC25A88DC267.description:
Contrasts primary and secondary sources on the topic to determine commonalities and differences in point of view, comprehensiveness,
and depth of specific detail

E76982942C6648308B14FC4C0C7FCCF6.description:
Evaluates the authority of a source by assessing the credentials and reputation of the author, creator or publisher, date of publication,
and length or comprehensiveness

16C3DC620C344E2481963EFA4A42DD3E.description:
Seeks information from alternative perspectives by browsing the shelves for related books, identifying people and organizations with
opposing views, following links to related articles, and conducting additional searches by using key ideas and terms for alternative
perspectives

517E6F7035EF4C88A25746BF472838F7.description:
Uses advanced searching strategies (Boolean operators, truncation, domain and format filters, analysis of URLs, relational searching) to
broaden and narrow searches and locate appropriate resources

A8215C33EC8C4C09BDE8429C1CB3F52F.description:
Uses search-engine organizational features (e.g., algorithm determining order of results, differentiation of sponsored content, beginning
text, URL) to locate web-based information to answer research questionsÂ

FBD3F72B472249F9BA073F176EC5DD44.description:
Uses organizational features of electronic books, databases, online articles and websites (e.g., menu bars, tabs, buttons, links, sidebars,
chapter titles, headings and subheadings, abstracts, pull quotes, visuals, boxed information) to locate information to answer research
questions

37C056D3991C4A02A151259F6211B62D.description:
Uses the organizational features of a book as well as abstracts, tables, charts and first and last chapters to locate main ideas, specific
supporting evidence, and a balanced perspective

D570C9E1CEB14B6885A88DC19C3E67F3.description: Plans inquiry to test hypothesis systematically or gather evidence to validate thesis

EFBB23C7AC0B436CA88D6BC1ACF20D48.description: Creates questions to lead to basic information and, in addition, to information that is more critical, complex, and diverse in perspectives

1DACAE889FA445BE8588E23F70FD99EB.description:
Refines questions to provide a framework for the inquiry and to fulfill the purpose of the research (e.g., questions to lead to historical
context and interpretation; questions to elicit accurate facts about scientific problem or issue)

07F7704752224177AB2C1207AC32A226.description: Explores problems or questions for which there are multiple answers or no âbestâ answerÂ

B6E22F061B97498BA3E4435BCC52F71C.description: Develops and refines the topic, problem, or question independently to arrive at a worthy and manageable topic for inquiry

9A23248C5D7F4EBBBC862DC838469C75.description: Develops a schema or mind map to express the big idea and the relationships among supporting ideas and topics of interest

D0D8B9B31570440F988AF4D8A5138A8B.description:
Gathers context about the time period, people, and issues surrounding the topic by reading laterally across both primary and secondary
sources

AA23466C1E644D4289E3DD19037299D6.description: Identifies key words, concepts, and synonyms, both stated and implied, for topic and uses them to further research

D0C15C9B35684DC3A99DA477F6466F69.description: Information-fluent learners use an inquiry process to connect to prior experience and background knowledge, wonder and ask questions, investigate, construct new understanding, express learning, and reflect on the process and product of learning.

B4928C8FE3D3449599D1C86EB0D113DF.description: Inquiry and Design Thinking: Use Inquiry and Design Thinking to Build Understanding and Create New Knowledge
